visualization_prompt: Generate a column chart showing monthly attendance patterns with outlier values using axis break visualization for discontinuous ranges

title.text: Visualized Axis Break in Seasonal Attendance

visualization_explanation: The dataset contains 12-month categorical temporal data with two quantitative series (μ=1,624, σ=1,482 for Family Resort; μ=1,373, σ=1,445 for Adventure Park). Synthetic values maintain domain consistency for attendance metrics, showing summer peak seasons (May-Sep) with magnitudes requiring axis breaks to preserve resolution in lower-range months. The column chart was selected to emphasize discrete monthly comparisons while maintaining data-ink efficiency through direct label integration. Axis break implementation follows Cairo's principle of salience - slanted zigzag patterns create immediate visual recognition of discontinuous ranges while preserving spatial relationships. Statistical coherence is maintained through consistent summer peak patterns (Jun-Jul μ=3,730) and winter lows (Dec-Feb μ=93) across both series.
